intro: Mygalurus delicatulus, commonly known as the delicate mygalurus, is a small, delicate plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant features rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central cup to collect water. Its flowers are typically small and inconspicuous, often hidden within the leaf rosette. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
